<<<api>>>: BufferedReader.readLine
<<<code>>>: public static String[] getLinesFromConsole() {
String strLine = "";
try {
InputStreamReader isr = new InputStreamReader(System.in);
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(isr);
String line = "";
while ((line = br.readLine()) != null && !line.equals("exit") )
strLine += br.readLine() + "~";
isr.close();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
return strLine.split("~");
}

Explanation:
The above code reads lines of text from the console until the user enters "exit". It avoids waiting for input from the console after the last line by using a while loop that continues to read lines until the condition is not met. This way, the BufferedReader.readLine() method will not wait for input from the console after the last line.
